awd_titl_txt: Development of a Method to Measure in Situ Phage                   Production Rates in the Sea
awd_abstract_narration: The quantitative role of bacteriophages in the biogeochemical                   cycles of the marine environment is a most urgent question.  At                 present, there is no direct method to measure phage production,                 only indirect estimates of phage production based on measures of                phage decay rates by Norwegians scientists.  This project will                  develop urgently needed and innovative techniques for measuring                 phage production in seawater.  Two radiotracer approaches will be               attempted to specifically measure DNA and RNA phage production.                 The approach is risky because the strategy is to metabolically                  label bacteria and secondarily the phage DNA and RNA.  The methods              will be calibrated and field tested to assess whether or not phage              proliferation is an important process in marine ecosystems.
